physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Glaucoma, retinopathy, growth retardation, osteopenia, hemolytic anemia with marked splenomegaly.

Markedly elevated total plasma porphyrins (162.3 µg/dL), uroporphyrin I in urine (5040 nmol/L) and in erythrocytes (1703 µg/dL), coproporphyrin I in urine (48,160 nmol/L) and in stool (3970 nmol/g), diagnosed with congenital erythropoietic porphyria (CEP).
Splenectomy performed; however, severe hemolytic anemia persisted.
Bone marrow transplant performed; normalization of hemoglobin observed.
Markedly decreased skin fragility, clearing of scars in light-exposed areas, normalization of developmental milestones.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement in skin fragility and overall development.
